fields.summary: 2012 LX Tail Lamp Close Out Panel Missing
Copy a project
REST API for user administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27781].
  {panel}

The usability of nested versions could be improved. Currently:

* You need GreenHopper.
* Nesting the versions occurs inside GreenHopper and not in the Managing Versions page where most naive users would look.
* You need to enable a project to be GreenHopper enabled. If you have hundreds, this gets daunting
* It pollutes the fixversion field with multiple fixversion values. This isn't a big deal but it's a consequence of the workaround GH had to do. 
* Delegating this task to project admins isn't always possible due to the learning curve. Here's a [doc I found|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AUG/Jira+Versioning+Process+using+Nested+Versions] on how one might do it.
fields.summary: Improve nested versions
Please bundle uTest connector version 1.1.1 in JOD 5.0.4
Track Issue creator separately from Reporter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27775].
  {panel}

Error creating issue: Unable to find field 'customfield_xxxxx'

After deleting an unused custom field, customers started complaining about receiving error message in title during issue creation. Issues were actually created, but some data was broken so I had to use JIRA integrity checker to correct problems.

Before removing the custom field, I removed it from all screens and field configurations. Afterwards JIRA did not complain during its deletion. But later, when customers complained, I found out that it was actually used in two workflows. I had to XML export the workflows, remove field references, import new workflows and adjust all projects' workflow schemes to fix the problem. It took a lot of time to find the cause and fix the problem.

JIRA should warn that a custom field appears in at least one workflow before letting it being deleted.
fields.summary: JIRA Should Warn if a Custom Field Appears in Workflow before Letting It Being Deleted

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27774].
  {panel}

Could the default email templates be modified to say why the email was sent. This can help with filtering and prioritising email.

bugzilla puts "You are receiving this mail because:" at the end of every mail with reasons like:
You reported the bug.
You are the assignee for the bug.
You are on the CC list for the bug.
fields.summary: Modify default email templates to say why email was sent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27772].
  {panel}

At least three requests for this feature have been made years ago but were refused to be addressed by Atlassian then. Unfortunately I could not reopen them so I am creating this new request because it is important for us:
JRA-3532 (created 2004)
JRA-15001 (created 2008)
JRA-19412 (created 2009)

I believe that this feature got more weight with more and stricter data and IT security acts and guidelines in today's businesses. Most important feature for me is a configurable expiry date of a user account. We too have our customers access our JIRA. We have no control over their employment there and we need to provide an appropriate security behavior to disable accounts automatically based on conditions. In our case, our internal security guideline for user accounts requires us to disable each external account after 365 days until they are requested to be reinstated.

I would like to request that Atlassian honors data and IT security requirments better ba adding these features to user management:
* User account expiry by date or duration
* Password expiry by date or duration
* Feature to disable an account
fields.summary: User account and password expiry

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27769].
  {panel}

See attached screenshot for a visual explanation.

The <header> area in which the "Add User" button is contained is floated. As such, the <header> has no height, and the <form> element overlaps it. Consequentially, the button's clickable area is obstructed by the overlap.

Ensuring the contents of the <header> area affect its height should resolve the problem.

Adding either a <br class="clear"/> or adding an overflow:auto; CSS style to the <header> will allow floated contents to affect the height of the <header>, thus solve the problem.
fields.summary: 'Add User' button in OnDemand can't always be clicked
as a REST API user I shoulld be able to edit non-required fields even if an issue has required fields that are not filled in.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27763].
  {panel}

As suggested by Arthur Gonçalves [Atlassian], here are my suggestion to help improve the upgrading process of JIRA (in our case, from 4.3.4 to 5.0.1). Please refer to JSP-122399.

During the upgrade, indicate the plugins that are no longer compatible or out of date and deactivate them. You could also add an options to remove those plugins.

You should be able to select the folder/place where you want to install the application (not use the previous folder).

Give the user (that performs the updates) an option to reconfigure the email settings

Re-install the service service (I had to do that manually and it was a pain since I wasn't the original installer).

Allow the use of multiple ports during the upgrade process instead of having to go through the xml file modification or use the JIRA web UI.
fields.summary: List of improvements that should be done to make JIRA upgrades easier.
Bundle newest JIM (which is compatible with new Add Project dialog)
Lock top navigation bar when scrolling
Need to be able to get project email via API
A new feature which will help in quickly getting an idea of the issue (description of the issue)

fields.description: We have a user in our JIRA directory that all of a sudden was member of the jira-adminstrator group. While we could not figure out how he got that membership we tried to remove him from the group. It does not work. We cannot remove the group jira-administrators from his user groups. You can remove the group out of the list, save, but he still remains member of that group.
fields.summary: Cannot remove user from group
Different access for local network (intranet) users and other users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27749].
  {panel}

When clicking change assignee the default selector is a simple drop down list. This is not very good compared to for example to selector used when selecting Reporter when doing simple searches.

Please add an option (preferably both client and global) OR change the default selector to be the better one, which is used for example when selecting Components or when doing a search in simple mode and selecting Reporter.

Example:
We currently have many users starting with Bjorn and you want to select Bjorn Bengtsson, you will have to type BJOR then space to bring up the whole list then use the arrow keys. A much easier and better way would be to just type BENG and it would select Bjorn Bengtsson.
fields.summary: Better Change Assignee Field

fields.description:
After a while JVM starts to think that there is a file missing in the file system.

The last incident happened after 6 days of uptime. These "unreachabe" files vary, but they all are JIRA .jsp template files (so far). Last time it was /includes/panels/issue/linking/inward.jsp (this file is also modified). 

The problem is not resolved by itself and thus needs a JIRA restart.

fields.summary: After a while JVM starts to think that there is a file missing in the file system, but it's there. java.io.FileNotFoundException: /includes/panels/issue/linking/inward.jsp

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27746].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:
Go to any frother issue picker (link issue for example)
1. Type the full key of an issue you know exists.
2. Wait for the dropdown to appear with only that issue in it
3. Click away with your mouse
4. Click okay/link

The request that is sent has two of the same issuekey.

Noticed this when trying to use frother issue picker for Bonfire.
fields.summary: Sometimes Frother Issue picker sends the same issuekey twice
Make the new limit for text fields limitable, by default OFF and configurable on the advanced config page
Application link version matrix documentation tidy up
On the jira "add user to groups" page, put the Join button on the top as well as the bottom of the groups list.
Attachment Section Should Remain Collapsed Even After User Performing Any Operation
Support tomcat7 and jdk7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27724].
  {panel}

Currently JIRA 5 already allows to import mails from a local directory. 
This import however does not recurse through subfolders nor does it recognize a maildir structure which is used by the MTA to deliver the mails to the filesystem on which JIRA resides. In this case it would have to look into the .cur and .new subdirectories to find the mails.
A further benefit of maildir support wouold be, that messages can be properly flagged as 'seen' or 'deleted' very much like on an IMAP connection.

Another nice to have feature would be to also allow "forwarding" of handled messages and error messages to sub-maildirs (e.g. 'handled' and 'error') of the import directory.

The JavaMaildir library could be used to provide a mailserver-like interface to maildirs: http://javamaildir.sourceforge.net/

We had implemented this as a plugin in JIRA 4.x, but with the massive changes in mail handling in JIRA 5 (no configuration of mail fetching services anymore) this no longer works.
fields.summary: Add proper maildir support for mail import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27722].
  {panel}

Hi,

It would be nice to define the counter value to start the issue Ids when importing a project.

For example, while importing a project from test instance to production instance, a user might want the issue keys to start from TST-1000 instead of TST-1. Currently this is not possible with out manually tweaking the database or the XML backup.


Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Allow modifying Issue numbering while using XML import

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27695].
  {panel}

Hi,

JIRA and GreenHopper requires to set the 'Time spent' and 'Remaining Estimate' during a 'Log Work'. The prefered agile way in Scrum is to only track the remaining estimate and do not waste time in thinking about the question "how much time should I log for ISSUE-4711".

It would be nice if the GreenHopper project configuration allows to change the log work behaviour like:

* use the classical "Time Spent" screen
* use a custom screen (and that custom screen can only contain the field remaining estimate)


Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Log Work screen to only ask for estimation and not for the time spent within GreenHopper

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27691].
  {panel}

For example, 

# Create a user on the JIRA instance named *admin*
# Create two users on your SVN server.  Ie. *admin* and *ADMIN*
** I use Visual SVN for this example, and create the two users.  These users are different since Visual SVN is case sensitive 
# Do a commit test for the user *admin*
# Do a commit test for the user *ADMIN*
# Access JIRA under *admin* and go to the user's profile activity stream.
** The activity stream will treat the user *ADMIN* and *admin* differently.  
!activitystream.png!

As you can see from the screen shot, *admin* and *ADMIN*'s commits fall under two different users.  It would be nice to have an option to force username to lower case so that the commits will fall under one single user.  This feature is similar that is offered in FishEye.  
!usernames.png!

By enabling the force to lower case option, the activity on the FishEye instance will fall under one user.  
!FishEye.png!

This way, all the commits on the activity stream will be under the one user (in this case, admin), not two different users.
fields.summary: Inconsistency between users (committers) on the profile activity stream
Make obvious warning when a user cannot edit their own user directory
All text field types should support wildcard searching in JQL.
new security level option for 'reporters group'
Support for Java 7

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27680].
  {panel}

Im having problems with the FROM email when i share or i mention anyone.

If jira send any notification, the from is "User fullname - email: jira@localhost.com"  this email is the localhost smtp from the server.

The problem is when i Share an issue or mention anyone in a comment. 

The from of this notification when i mention or share is the user email, not the outgoing email used in normal notifications. 

Example:  

-From: $fullname (JIRA) <augusto.gregorio@mycompany.com>

The problem using this email, is that when a email is send with this "from" to another exchange email @mycompany.com  i get an error.  

If i mention anyone outside my exchange network theres no problem in sending the email because theres no server validation.


So what i want is to change the from, so if any user mention or share, the email is send throw the Outgoing email:  jira@localhost.com     like all the automated notifications.

Example:

      $fullname (jira)          Correct Email         Incorrect
from: Augusto Gregorio (jira)  <jira@localhost.com>   USER PERSONAL EMAIL


Please see attachment, and sorry for my english.

Regards.
Augusto.
fields.summary: Email From problem

fields.description:
When trying to import a single project 505 error appears.

Steps:
# I have jira_src and jira_dst instances (trying move project from jira_src to jira_dst)
# Did a full xml backup from jira_src
# jira_src and jira_dst have both the same version of all
# Synced all workflows/issue type/schemes from jira_src to jira_dst
# Checked that no projects in jira_dst with same key or name with jira_src(already discovered issue when two project with same name but different keys exists)
# copied full backup of jira_src to jira-home/import/ on jira_dst
# copied attachments from jira_src to jira-home/import/attachments on jira_dst
# Login into jira_dst instance
# Go to administration -> project import
# Entered filename and pressed "Next"
# Got 505 Error

See attachment html page with error.

Also I did the simpler step:
# go to jira_src admin page
# do a full backup
# put backup file in *same* instance jira_src in jira-home/import folder
# go to jira_src admin page (same instance with same configuration)
# go to project import
# import from full backup
# got 505 error
fields.summary: Project Import Tool always throws NPE

  {panel}

Currently, emails are associated with a project through the mail handler configuration, with all mail associated with an account sent to the same project.

Some customers would prefer to have a single mail address for their whole organization, like support@atlassian.com, and to have that mail automatically sorted to the appropriate project.

Or using Project Key to create issue in the email respectively, this will make more easier than configuring multiple mail handler and mail server.

One use case would be to have a mapping of users who are only allowed to use a single project, and to always create issues based on mail from that email addres in the associated project.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort emails to a project automatically

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27670].
  {panel}

Rendering very large texts can easily lead to memory problems. Details from [Comment on JIRA-24623|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24623?focusedCommentId=301018&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-301018]
bq. When rendering is done (especially Wiki markup rendering and Velocity rendering) the data must go into memory multiple times.
[Proposed solution|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24623?focusedCommentId=301018&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-301018]
bq. One other thought some one had (Ian I think) is that we could CHOP the large data at say 30K and then put all the data into an "auto generated attachment" (description_to_large1.txt) and then reference that file in the chopped version
fields.summary: Chop too long texts to avoid memory issues during rendering
Reject submit of too long text already on client side
The text length of a comment should be limited

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27665].
  {panel}

We are using direct links to the jira web interface from our applications for quicker error reporting. Some fields, especially the project and environment are filled in already, which makes life of our testers a lot easier, because we collect a lot of environment information (plugin revision number, host software and version, operating system, machine specs, graphics card model and driver version, etc.) which is otherwise a pain to have ready always.

Also using the REST Api is a big issue, because we'd have to add http support, json processing, etc. to our plugins, while using OS calls to bring up a browser with these infos encoded in the url is really easy.

So this is great, the only thing that is a little bit of a nuisance is that for people having the "change reporter" permission, the reporter is set to nobody by default. Storing the Jira user name in our plugin just so we can put it into the url seems a little bit wasteful, but if we don't pass it, the user has to put it there manually, even though he just logged in.

If calling a URL directly without user name could default to the logged in user or if there were a magic number that sets the field to the currently logged in user, this would make our experience perfect. The Assignee field for example can be set to automatic by passing assignee=-1.
fields.summary: Allow the reporter field to be set to the person logged in when directly linking to an issue creation
Refresh Interval < 15minutes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27660].
  {panel}

As a global JIRA admin, I can configure default project dashboards, which get automatically added to a project member on project creation and/or project member change, so that my users can see the status of all their projects without manual interaction.

h1.BACKGROUND
In our organization, users usually are working on a set of short to mid term projects. Hence new projects get created regularly and users get added or removed regularly.

The desire is to have a common default dashboard, which reports the project status in the scope of the respective project, which does not require manual configuration. On project creation, this dashboard should be automatically made available based on a central template and should get pushed to all current and future project members.

Users would see dashboards for all the projects, they are assigned to after directly after login, without the need of manually adding/configuring a dashboard.

h1.SCOPE OUTLINE
- Create and maintain auto-dashboard templates per project type in the admin interface. Potentially multiple auto-dashboards (e.g. one with a general overview, one focused on defects)
- Auto-Dashboard templates are based on the "standard" dashboard gadgets
- The gadgets are based on filters, which ignore any project context.
- If an auto-dashboard is added to the dashboards for a user, he context of the affected project is automatically added to the underlying filters
- When a user gets added to a project, the auto-dashboard will be added to the favourite dashboards. If he gets removed, the auto-dashboard also gets removed
- Users can opt-out of these dashboards.
fields.summary: Define default project dashboards and add them to project members

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27622].
  {panel}

The document at http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server does not specifically handle the use-case of maintaining a staging server. For example:

# Disable mail handlers
# Pointing any applinks to other dev instances
# Recommendation to change the color in the UI, so staff know they are on a dev server
(/) You may also wish to use a custom icon and favicon, preferably ones that are brash and "in your face".
# Where to get a dev server license

Also that doc talks about upgrading.

----

*UPDATE:*

The [Migrating JIRA to Another Server|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Migrating+JIRA+to+Another+Server] document _*is not the correct page for this doc task*_.

The instructions for creating a staging server are documented on [Establishing Staging Server Environments for JIRA|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Establishing+Staging+Server+Environments+for+JIRA].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27613].
{panel}
*Background*
JIRA does not natively support the idea of field level security (JRA-1330), the most popular of which is the ability to the hide Time Tracking fields from customers (JRA-2364). We know that a lot of customers really want a way for JIRA to solve this kind of problem.

*View Ports*
Internally at Atlassian we have been throwing around the idea of what we call "View Ports". The idea behind this is that admins can configure an alternative view of the JIRA View Issue screen for different groups. One of the items that can be configured is the ability to choose what fields are shown in the View Port.

*Example Scenario*
You have a company that specialises in custom development solutions and have 10 internal staff members with 200 external customers. You want to manage all your issues in one JIRA project but you do not want to expose the time tracking fields to your customers.

*View Port Solution*
1. Admin creates a JIRA group for all the 'external customers'. 
2. Admin then creates a View Port for this group only.
3. Admin configures the View Port to show all fields except time tracking.

When anyone in the 'external customers' group logs into a specific url, they are taken to this View Port. They will not be able to login into the normal JIRA system.

*Comments Please*
We'd love to get your feedback in this solution and if it would work for your company.
fields.summary: Alternative JIRA Views

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-27594].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

There is no way to search via JQL to get accurate results in regards to issues / comments were a user has been @Mentioned For example, users have noted that you can sometimes get results for an advanced JQL query such as
{code:java}
comment ~ currentUser() 
{code}
However the ~ operator is unsupported for use with that function per [Advanced searching - functions reference - Atlassian Documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-functions-reference-764478342.html#Advancedsearching-functionsreference-currentUsercurrentUser()].

Also trying to search with a more basic set of terms like 
{code:java}
comment ~ username
{code}
can sometimes return results, but in the current state of Jira Cloud it is not providing consistent  expected results (sometimes you see @ mentions here but not always), and given the recent changes to usernames in Atlassian Cloud, there does not appear to be a way to search via JQL for message content that includes @mentions
h3. Suggested Solution

Creating a JQL function that can search for @ Mentions would be ideal
 Or extending the comment field to be searchable by user accounts mentioned within it
h3. Why this is important

It would be very helpful to be able to search, filter, and generally organize issues where you have been mentioned directly.
h3. Workaround

None
h3. Original description

Would like to be able to create a filter to track my AT mentions
fields.summary: JQL search for @mentions

fields.description:
Jira crashes frequently (once a day) with an OutOfMemory Error. The final error message does not contain additional information.

*Stderr

19/Mar/2012 11:50:47 org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11AprProtocol pause
INFO: Pausing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-80
19/Mar/2012 11:50:47 org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11AprProtocol pause
INFO: Pausing Coyote HTTP/1.1 on http-8080
19/Mar/2012 11:50:48 org.apache.catalina.core.StandardService stop
INFO: Stopping service Catalina
